*Psammodromus algirus* is an algerian lizard as implied from the genus "algirus", which can also be found in Morocco and part of Spain (Mateo et al., 2009).

*P. algirus* resides in the coastal pinewoods of the Mediterranean thicket as well as in more arid, shrubby and sandy zones. It measures about 18 - 30 cm long.
Utilizing their keen eyesight, excelled hearing and agility, they prey on grasshoppers, coleopterans, ants, spiders by suddenly jumping on them (Mazza, 2003).
